ground_truth: Mickey stares at the X-ray, horrified, and is then seen leaving the hospital. He strides slowly, his shoulders slouched, his hands in his pockets, and his voice is heard over the screen as he crosses the street, continuing his self-absorbed walk on the opposite side while occasional traffic goes by. Mickey brushes against a heavyset man who gives him a nasty look, but Mickey is so dazed, he doesn't even notice. The dark bedroom is abruptly lit as Mickey, lying in his bed, wakes up with a start and turns on his night-table lamp. Mickey, still ruminating, stands up, fixes his pants, and walks out of his bedroom loft into a dark upper hallway. He walks down a spiral staircase into the dark living room, and the film cuts to a flashback of Mickey's past. Dr. Smith, sitting behind his desk, faces the camera, with rows of periodicals lining the wall behind him. The camera moves to Dr. Smith's point of view: Hannah and Mickey are sitting on the opposite side of the desk, looking stunned. The camera moves back to the stunned Mickey and Hannah, following Dr. Smith with their eyes as he walks back to his high-backed leather chair behind the desk and sits down. As he talks, the camera moves closer and closer to his face. Mickey and Hannah walk on the sidewalk, oblivious of the passing pedestrians, with Hannah crying and blowing her nose. Hannah sobs, clutching her tissue to her face as they walk offscreen, and the film cuts to Hannah and Mickey's living room, which is brightly lit and cluttered with pillows and plants. Norman and Carol, his wife, sit on the couch drinking coffee. Mickey walks from the kitchen into the living room, holding a half-eaten chocolate cake on a serving plate while the sun pours through the windows he passes. Hannah is briefly seen in the background, preparing more coffee in the kitchen. Mickey puts the cake down on the coffee table, which is already crowded with assorted plants, plates, and a bamboo tray holding utensils and napkins. Mickey sighs and flops down on an adjoining couch, rubbing his forehead. Norman chuckles, and Mickey starts to pace. Hannah, her hands clasped near her face, glances briefly at Carol and sighs. Mickey pauses for a moment, collecting his thoughts, then stops his pacing and looks at the group before starting to pace behind the couch anew. Norman and Carol remain silent as Mickey stops pacing and leans on the couch behind Norman, rubbing his hands on his knees, then leans back against the wall. Norman and Carol turn to each other, reacting, and Carol glances at Norman and chuckles nervously while he takes a sip of coffee. Hannah reaches for the cake as Carol and Norman exchange glances, reacting.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Mickey gazes at the X-ray, appalled, and is then observed departing the hospital. He strides sluggishly, his shoulders hunched, his hands in his pockets, and his voice is heard over the screen as he traverses the street, continuing his self-centered walk on the opposite side while sporadic traffic goes by. Mickey brushes against a stout man who gives him a nasty look, but Mickey is so stunned, he doesn't even notice. The dim bedroom is suddenly lit as Mickey, lying in his bed, awakens with a start and turns on his night-stand lamp. Mickey, still pondering, stands up, adjusts his trousers, and walks out of his bedroom loft into a dark upper hallway. He walks down a winding staircase into the dim living room, and the film cuts to a flashback of Mickey's past. Dr. Smith, seated behind his desk, faces the camera, with rows of magazines lining the wall behind him. The camera shifts to Dr. Smith's perspective: Hannah and Mickey are sitting on the opposite side of the desk, looking shocked. The camera shifts back to the shocked Mickey and Hannah, following Dr. Smith with their eyes as he walks back to his high-backed leather chair behind the desk and sits down. As he speaks, the camera moves closer and closer to his face. Mickey and Hannah walk on the sidewalk, unaware of the passing pedestrians, with Hannah weeping and blowing her nose. Hannah sobs, clutching her tissue to her face as they walk offscreen, and the film cuts to Hannah and Mickey's living room, which is brightly illuminated and cluttered with cushions and plants. Norman and Carol, his spouse, sit on the couch drinking coffee. Mickey walks from the kitchen into the living room, holding a half-consumed chocolate cake on a serving plate while the sun streams through the windows he passes. Hannah is briefly seen in the background, preparing more coffee in the kitchen. Mickey places the cake down on the coffee table, which is already crowded with assorted plants, plates, and a bamboo tray holding utensils and napkins. Mickey sighs and flops down on an adjoining couch, rubbing his forehead. Norman chuckles, and Mickey starts to pace. Hannah, her hands clasped near her face, glances briefly at Carol and sighs. Mickey pauses for a moment, collecting his thoughts, then stops his pacing and looks at the group before starting to pace behind the couch anew. Norman and Carol remain silent as Mickey stops pacing and leans on the couch behind Norman, rubbing his hands on his knees, then leans back against the wall. Norman and Carol turn to each other, reacting, and Carol glances at Norman and chuckles nervously while he takes a sip of coffee. Hannah reaches for the cake as Carol and Norman exchange glances, reacting.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The X-ray is stared at by Mickey, horrified, and Mickey is then seen leaving the hospital. The street is slowly crossed by him, his shoulders slouched, his hands in his pockets, and over the screen, his voice is heard as he continues his self-absorbed walk on the opposite side while occasional traffic goes by. A heavyset man is brushed against by Mickey, who gives Mickey a nasty look, but Mickey is so dazed that the nasty look is not even noticed by him. Mickey, lying in his bed, wakes up with a start, and his night-table lamp is turned on abruptly by him, lighting the dark bedroom. Still ruminating, he stands up, fixes his pants, and his bedroom loft is walked out of by him into a dark upper hallway. A spiral staircase is walked down by him into the dark living room, and a flashback to Mickey's past is cut to by the film. Dr. Smith faces the camera, with rows of periodicals lining the wall behind him, as he sits behind his desk. The camera is moved to Dr. Smith's point of view: Hannah and Mickey are seen sitting on the opposite side of the desk, looking stunned. The stunned Mickey and Hannah are moved back to by the camera, following Dr. Smith with their eyes as Dr. Smith walks back to his high-backed leather chair behind the desk and sits down. His face is moved closer and closer to by the camera as he talks. Mickey and Hannah are seen walking on the sidewalk, oblivious of the passing pedestrians, with Hannah crying and blowing her nose. Hannah clutches her tissue to her face, sobbing as they walk offscreen, and the film cuts to the brightly lit and cluttered living room of Hannah and Mickey, with pillows and plants scattered around. The couch is sat on by Norman and Carol, his wife, drinking coffee. Mickey walks into the living room from the kitchen, holding a half-eaten chocolate cake on a serving plate while the sun pours through the windows passed by him. In the background, Hannah is briefly seen preparing more coffee in the kitchen. The cake is put down by Mickey on the coffee table, already crowded with assorted plants, plates, and a bamboo tray holding utensils and napkins. Mickey sighs and an adjoining couch is flopped down on by him, rubbing his forehead. Norman chuckles while Mickey starts to pace. Carol is glanced at briefly by Hannah, her hands clasped near her face, and Hannah sighs. Mickey pauses for a moment, collects his thoughts, then the group is looked at by him before his pacing is stopped, and pacing is resumed behind the couch anew. Silence is maintained by Norman and Carol as Mickey's pacing is stopped and the couch behind Norman is leaned on by Mickey while rubbing his hands on his knees, then Mickey leans back against the wall. To each other, Norman and Carol turn, reacting, and a nervous chuckle is given by Carol as she glances at Norman while a sip of coffee is taken by him. Reaching for the cake, Hannah glances at Carol and Norman exchanging glances, reacting.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Mickey stares at the X-ray, horrified, and leaves the hospital, walking slowly with slouched shoulders and hands in pockets. His voice is heard as he crosses the street, brushing against a heavyset man who gives him a dirty look, but Mickey is too dazed to notice. The dark bedroom lights up as Mickey wakes and turns on his lamp. He stands, adjusts his pants, and exits his bedroom into a dim hallway, then descends a spiral staircase into the dark living room. A flashback shows Dr. Smith behind his desk, with periodicals lining the wall. Hannah and Mickey sit stunned opposite him as he returns to his chair, the camera zooming in on his face. Mickey and Hannah walk the sidewalk, oblivious to passersby, with Hannah crying. They exit the screen, and it cuts to their brightly lit, cluttered living room. Norman and Carol sip coffee on the couch as Mickey enters with a chocolate cake, sunlight streaming through windows. He places the cake on a crowded table, sighs, then flops down, rubbing his forehead. Norman chuckles as Mickey paces. Hannah clasps her hands, sighing, and Mickey pauses, paces anew, then stops, leaning on the couch. Norman and Carol exchange glances; Carol chuckles nervously. Hannah reaches for the cake, and Carol and Norman react with exchanged glances.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Mickey stares at the X-ray, horrified, then leaves the hospital, walking with slouched shoulders and hands in pockets, oblivious to traffic and a heavyset man he brushes against. In his dark bedroom, he wakes up abruptly, turns on his lamp, stands, and exits into a dim hallway. He descends a spiral staircase into a dark living room, leading to a flashback of Dr. Smith's office, where Hannah and Mickey appear stunned. As Dr. Smith speaks, the camera zooms in on his face. Mickey and a tearful Hannah walk on the sidewalk, oblivious to pedestrians, before the scene shifts to their cluttered, sunlit living room. Norman and Carol drink coffee on the couch as Mickey enters with a half-eaten chocolate cake. He sighs, sits, rubs his forehead, then paces, while Hannah, in the kitchen, sighs and clasps her hands. Mickey pauses to collect his thoughts, resumes pacing, then leans on the couch. Norman and Carol exchange glances, with Carol chuckling nervously. Hannah reaches for cake as Carol and Norman react.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Mickey stands frozen, his eyes fixated on the X-ray with an expression that can only be described as sheer horror etched across his face. Subsequently, he is seen making his way out of the hospital, moving at a slow and deliberate pace. His shoulders are hunched over, creating a defeated silhouette, and his hands are buried deep within his pockets, a testament to his inner turmoil. As his voice resonates over the scene, he is observed crossing the street, continuing his preoccupied and introspective walk on the other side, completely oblivious to the occasional traffic that flows by. During his dazed state, Mickey accidentally brushes against a man of considerable size, who promptly shoots him a nasty glare. However, Mickey is so lost in his thoughts that he remains utterly unaware of the man's displeasure. 

In a sudden transition, the scene shifts to Mickey's dark bedroom, which is abruptly flooded with light as he awakens with a jolt, instinctively reaching to turn on the lamp perched on his night-table. Still deep in thought, he rises to his feet, adjusts his pants thoughtfully, and exits his bedroom loft, stepping into the dimly lit upper hallway. He then descends a spiral staircase that leads him into the shadowy living room, and the narrative seamlessly transitions into a flashback from Mickey's past.

Dr. Smith, positioned behind his desk, is captured by the camera's lens, with rows of neatly arranged periodicals forming a backdrop behind him. The perspective shifts to Dr. Smith's point of view, revealing Hannah and Mickey seated on the opposite side of the desk, looking completely stunned. The camera then returns to focus on the stunned expressions of Mickey and Hannah, who continuously follow Dr. Smith with their eyes as he makes his way back to his high-backed leather chair behind the desk and settles down. As Dr. Smith begins to speak, the camera steadily draws closer and closer to his face.

Following this, Mickey and Hannah are seen moving along the sidewalk, seemingly oblivious to the pedestrians who weave past them. Hannah, overwhelmed with emotion, is in tears, wiping her nose with a tissue as they drift offscreen. The scene transitions once more to Hannah and Mickey's living room, which is brightly illuminated and cluttered with an assortment of pillows and plants. Norman and his wife, Carol, are seated on the couch, enjoying their coffee. Mickey emerges from the kitchen, carrying a half-eaten chocolate cake on a serving plate, while the warm sunlight streams through the windows he passes. In the background, Hannah is momentarily visible, busy preparing additional coffee in the kitchen. 

Mickey carefully places the cake down on the already crowded coffee table, which is littered with various plants, plates, and a bamboo tray filled with utensils and napkins. He sighs heavily and collapses onto an adjoining couch, rubbing his forehead in evident frustration. Norman lets out a chuckle, provoking Mickey to begin pacing back and forth. Hannah, her hands clasped gently near her face, glances briefly at Carol and lets out a sigh. Mickey halts momentarily, gathers his thoughts, and then resumes his pacing behind the couch. Norman and Carol maintain their silence as Mickey stops, leans on the couch behind Norman, rubbing his hands on his knees, and then shifts back to rest against the wall. Norman and Carol exchange looks, reacting to the tension in the room, with Carol glancing nervously at Norman while he sips his coffee. Meanwhile, Hannah reaches for the cake as Carol and Norman continue to exchange meaningful glances, silently reacting to the unfolding drama.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Mickey is standing utterly motionless, with his eyes fixated intensely on the X-ray, his expression unmistakably one of sheer horror carved deeply into his features. After this moment of shock, he is later seen gradually making his way out of the hospital, moving with a slow and deliberate gait. His shoulders slump forward, casting a defeated and forlorn silhouette, as his hands are deeply buried within his pockets, a silent testament to the inner turmoil he is grappling with. As his voice resounds over the scene, he is observed crossing the street, maintaining his preoccupied and introspective walking pace on the opposite side, entirely oblivious to the occasional passing traffic that flows by him. During this dazed and distracted state, Mickey inadvertently brushes against a man of considerable size, who promptly responds by shooting him a nasty glare. However, Mickey, so lost and consumed in his own thoughts, remains completely unaware of the man's obvious displeasure.

In a sudden and unexpected transition, the scene shifts dramatically to Mickey's dark and shadowy bedroom, which is abruptly flooded with light as he awakens with a startled jolt, instinctively reaching out to turn on the lamp perched on his night-table. Still deeply absorbed in thought, he rises to his feet, thoughtfully adjusts his pants, and exits his bedroom loft, stepping carefully into the dimly lit upper hallway. He then descends the winding spiral staircase that leads him into the shadowy living room, and the narrative smoothly transitions into a vivid flashback from Mickey's past.

Dr. Smith, positioned authoritatively behind his desk, is captured by the camera's lens, with rows of neatly arranged periodicals forming an organized backdrop behind him. The perspective shifts fluidly to Dr. Smith's viewpoint, revealing Hannah and Mickey seated on the opposite side of the desk, both appearing utterly stunned and bewildered. The camera then swivels back to focus closely on the startled expressions of Mickey and Hannah, who continue to follow Dr. Smith with their eyes intently as he makes his way back to his high-backed leather chair behind the desk and settles down comfortably. As Dr. Smith begins to speak, the camera gradually draws closer and closer to his face, capturing every nuance.

Following this moment, Mickey and Hannah are seen moving slowly along the sidewalk, seemingly oblivious to the stream of pedestrians weaving seamlessly past them. Hannah, overwhelmed with emotion, is in tears, wiping her nose with a tissue as they drift offscreen. The scene transitions smoothly once more to Hannah and Mickey's living room, which is brightly illuminated and cluttered with an eclectic assortment of pillows and plants. Norman and his wife, Carol, are seated comfortably on the couch, enjoying their coffee. Mickey emerges from the kitchen, carrying a half-eaten chocolate cake on a serving plate, while the warm sunlight streams gently through the windows as he passes by. In the background, Hannah is momentarily visible, busy preparing additional coffee in the kitchen.

Mickey carefully places the cake down on the already crowded coffee table, which is littered with various plants, plates, and a bamboo tray filled with utensils and napkins. He sighs heavily, collapsing onto an adjoining couch and rubbing his forehead in evident frustration and distress. Norman lets out a chuckle, provoking Mickey to begin pacing restlessly back and forth. Hannah, with her hands clasped gently near her face, glances briefly at Carol and lets out a sigh. Mickey halts momentarily, gathers his thoughts, and then resumes his pacing behind the couch. Norman and Carol maintain their silence as Mickey pauses, leaning on the couch behind Norman, rubbing his hands on his knees, and then shifts back to rest against the wall. Norman and Carol exchange meaningful glances, reacting to the palpable tension in the room, with Carol glancing nervously at Norman while he sips his coffee. Meanwhile, Hannah reaches for the cake as Carol and Norman continue to exchange meaningful glances, silently reacting to the unfolding drama around them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Mickey stands frozen before the X-ray image, his face etched with horror, and moments later, he is seen exiting the sterile environment of the hospital. As he moves, he adopts a slow, deliberate stride, his shoulders drooping under an unseen weight, and his hands burrowed deep in his pockets. His voice, detached yet laden with emotion, resonates over the scene as he meanders across the street, his focus inward as traffic intermittently whooshes past him. Crossing to the opposite sidewalk, he becomes momentarily entangled with a heavyset man, brushing against him and eliciting a hostile glare that Mickey, lost in thought, fails to register. In a jarring transition, the pitch-black bedroom is suddenly bathed in light as Mickey, startled awake in his bed by unseen thoughts, fumbles to turn on the lamp beside him. Burdened by his ongoing reflections, he rises from the bed, straightens his disheveled pants, and proceeds out of his loft bedroom into a shadowy upper hallway. Descending the spiral staircase, he steps into the dimly lit living room, only for the film to transition to a flashback steeped in tension. Dr. Smith is stationed behind his desk, facing the camera, a wall of periodicals forming a backdrop behind him. The camera shifts to capture Dr. Smith's perspective, revealing Hannah and Mickey seated opposite him, their expressions mirrored in shock. The camera returns focus to the dazed pair, their eyes tracking Dr. Smith as he moves back to settle into his high-backed leather chair. As he begins to speak, the camera closes in on his face, amplifying the gravity of his words. Outside, on a bustling sidewalk, Mickey and Hannah walk amidst the crowd, disconnected from the world around them; Hannah weeps openly, clutching a tissue to her face. They continue on, oblivious to passersby, until they fade from view, and the scene transitions to a brightly illuminated and inviting living room, brimming with pillows and lush greenery. Seated comfortably on the couch, Norman and his wife, Carol, sip coffee in the filtered sunlight. Mickey emerges from the kitchen, balancing a partially devoured chocolate cake on a serving plate, as warm sunlight streams through the windows in his path. Briefly visible in the background, Hannah busies herself brewing more coffee. Mickey deposits the cake on the coffee table, already a mosaic of plants, plates, and a bamboo tray organized with utensils and napkins. With a sigh, he collapses onto a nearby couch, weary fingers massaging his forehead. Norman, with a chuckle, watches as Mickey begins to pace, his thoughts turbulent. Hannah, hands pressed near her face, shares a glance with Carol before letting out a sigh of her own. Mickey halts his pacing momentarily, gathering his thoughts, then resumes his restless pacing behind the couch. Norman and Carol maintain a silence steeped in anticipation as Mickey once again pauses, leaning over the couch back behind Norman, hands rubbing his knees before he reclines against the wall. Reacting, Norman and Carol exchange a silent conversation through glances, Carol offering a nervous chuckle as Norman sips his coffee. Hannah reaches for the cake, and as Carol and Norman share another glance, their reactions seethe with unspoken understanding amidst the shared turmoil.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Mickey, horrified by the X-ray, leaves the hospital and walks in a daze, crossing the street while oblivious to his surroundings, even brushing against a heavyset man who glares at him. At home, a night is disturbed as he awakens abruptly, turns on his lamp, and heads into the dark upper hallway, descending a spiral staircase into the living room. The scene shifts to a flashback: Dr. Smith, at his desk, informs a stunned Mickey and Hannah of troubling news. The camera focuses intently on Dr. Smith's face as he speaks. Later, Mickey and Hannah walk the sidewalk, oblivious to others, with Hannah sobbing as she clutches a tissue. The film transitions to their living room, where Norman and his wife Carol sit drinking coffee. Mickey enters from the kitchen with a half-eaten chocolate cake and places it on a crowded coffee table. He flops onto the couch, rubs his forehead, and starts pacing. Hannah and Carol exchange glances while Norman chuckles. Mickey pauses to gather his thoughts, then resumes pacing, eventually leaning against the wall. Norman and Carol, exchanging silent reactions, watch as Mickey and Hannah navigate their uncertainty.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Mickey stares at the X-ray, horrified by the results revealed during his recent visit to Mount Sinai Hospital, a leading medical facility in the city, and is then seen leaving the hospital. He strides slowly, his shoulders slouched from the weight of concern, his hands in his pockets, and his voice is heard over the screen as he crosses the street in this bustling Manhattan neighborhood, continuing his self-absorbed walk on the opposite side while occasional traffic, typical of New York's busy avenues, goes by. Mickey brushes against a heavyset man who gives him a nasty look, but Mickey is so dazed, he doesn't even notice. The dark bedroom in his loft, known for its industrial style and high ceilings, is abruptly lit as Mickey, lying in his bed, wakes up with a start and turns on his night-table lamp. Mickey, still ruminating over the news from the doctor, stands up, fixes his pants, and walks out of his bedroom loft into a dark upper hallway that echoes with the creaks of its wooden floorboards. He walks down a spiral staircase, a design element popular in urban apartments, into the dark living room, and the film cuts to a flashback of Mickey's past. Dr. Smith, a renowned oncologist in the city, sitting behind his desk, faces the camera, with rows of periodicals lining the wall behind him, evidence of his continuous engagement with the latest medical research. The camera moves to Dr. Smith's point of view: Hannah and Mickey are sitting on the opposite side of the desk, looking stunned by the gravity of the diagnosis. The camera moves back to the stunned Mickey and Hannah, following Dr. Smith with their eyes as he walks back to his high-backed leather chair, a symbol of his authoritative presence, behind the desk and sits down. As he talks, the camera moves closer and closer to his face, capturing the intensity of the moment. Mickey and Hannah walk on the sidewalk in their Upper West Side neighborhood, oblivious of the passing pedestrians, with Hannah crying and blowing her nose into a tissue handed to her by Mickey. Hannah sobs, clutching her tissue to her face as they walk offscreen, and the film cuts to Hannah and Mickey's living room, which is brightly lit by the afternoon sun streaming through large windows and cluttered with pillows and plants, creating an inviting yet chaotic atmosphere. Norman and Carol, his wife and long-time friends of the couple, sit on the couch drinking coffee, their cups steaming in the cool air. Mickey walks from the kitchen into the living room, holding a half-eaten chocolate cake on a serving plate, a gesture of comfort, while the sun pours through the windows he passes, highlighting the dust particles in the air. Hannah is briefly seen in the background, preparing more coffee in the kitchen with an espresso machine. Mickey puts the cake down on the coffee table, which is already crowded with assorted plants, plates, and a bamboo tray holding utensils and napkins, an indicator of their penchant for hosting friends. Mickey sighs and flops down on an adjoining couch, rubbing his forehead, trying to ease the tension. Norman chuckles, attempting to lighten the mood, and Mickey starts to pace, a habit he's picked up during stressful times. Hannah, her hands clasped near her face, glances briefly at Carol and sighs, sharing a silent moment of understanding. Mickey pauses for a moment, collecting his thoughts, then stops his pacing and looks at the group before starting to pace behind the couch anew, lost in his thoughts. Norman and Carol remain silent as Mickey stops pacing and leans on the couch behind Norman, rubbing his hands on his knees, then leans back against the wall covered with framed photos of happier times. Norman and Carol turn to each other, reacting with subtle concern, and Carol glances at Norman and chuckles nervously while he takes a sip of coffee, savoring its comforting warmth. Hannah reaches for the cake as Carol and Norman exchange glances, reacting to the tense yet supportive gathering.

He strides slowly his shoulders slouched his hands in his pockets and his voice is heard over the screen as he crosses the street continuing his selfabsorbed walk on the opposite side. while occasional traffic goes by Mickey brushes against a heavyset man who gives him a nasty look but Mickey is so dazed he does not even notice. The dark bedroom is abruptly lit as Mickey lying in his bed wakes up with a start and turns on his nighttable lamp. Mickey still ruminating stands up fixes his pants and walks out of his bedroom loft into a dark upper hallway. He walks down a spiral staircase into the dark living room and the film cuts to a flashback of Mickey's past. Dr Smith sitting behind his desk faces the camera with rows of periodicals lining the wall behind him. The camera moves to Dr Smith's point of view. Hannah and Mickey are sitting on the opposite side of the desk looking stunned. The camera moves back to the stunned Mickey and Hannah following Dr Smith with their eyes as he walks back to his highbacked leather chair behind the desk and sits down. As he talks the camera moves closer and closer to his face. Mickey and Hannah walk on the sidewalk oblivious of the passing pedestrians with Hannah crying and blowing her nose. Hannah sobs clutching her tissue to her face as they walk offscreen and the film cuts to Hannah and Mickey's living room which is brightly lit and cluttered with pillows and plants. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. Norman and Carol his wife sit on the couch drinking coffee. Mickey walks from the kitchen into the living room holding a halfeaten chocolate cake on a serving plate. while the sun pours through the windows he passes. Hannah is briefly seen in the background preparing more coffee in the kitchen. Mickey puts the cake down on the coffee table which is already crowded with assorted plants plates and a bamboo tray holding utensils and napkins. Mickey sighs and flops down on an adjoining couch rubbing his forehead. Norman chuckles and Mickey starts to pace. Hannah her hands clasped near her face glances briefly at Carol and sighs. Mickey pauses for a moment collecting his thoughts then stops his pacing and looks at the group before starting to pace behind the couch anew. Norman and Carol remain silent as Mickey stops pacing and leans on the couch behind. Norman rubbing his hands on his knees then leans back against the wall. Norman and Carol turn to each other reacting and Carol glances at Norman and chuckles nervously while he takes a sip of coffee. Hannah reaches for the cake as Carol and Norman exchange glances reacting.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffe stares at the X-ray, horrified, and is then seen leaving the hospital. It strides slowly, its shoulders slouched, its hands in its pockets, and its voice is heard over the screen as it crosses the street, continuing its self-absorbed walk on the opposite side while occasional traffic goes by. The giraffe brushes against a heavyset man who gives it a nasty look, but the giraffe is so dazed, it doesn't even notice. The dark bedroom is abruptly lit as the giraffe, lying in its bed, wakes up with a start and turns on its night-table lamp. The giraffe, still ruminating, stands up, fixes its pants, and walks out of its bedroom loft into a dark upper hallway. It walks down a spiral staircase into the dark living room, and the film cuts to a flashback of the giraffe's past. The penguin, sitting behind his desk, faces the camera, with rows of periodicals lining the wall behind him. The camera moves to the penguin's point of view: The rabbit and the giraffe are sitting on the opposite side of the desk, looking stunned. The camera moves back to the stunned giraffe and rabbit, following the penguin with their eyes as he walks back to his high-backed leather chair behind the desk and sits down. As he talks, the camera moves closer and closer to his face. The giraffe and rabbit walk on the sidewalk, oblivious of the passing pedestrians, with the rabbit crying and blowing its nose. The rabbit sobs, clutching its tissue to its face as they walk offscreen, and the film cuts to the rabbit and giraffe's living room, which is brightly lit and cluttered with pillows and plants. The flamingo and the fox, his wife, sit on the couch drinking coffee. The giraffe walks from the kitchen into the living room, holding a half-eaten chocolate cake on a serving plate while the sun pours through the windows it passes. The rabbit is briefly seen in the background, preparing more coffee in the kitchen. The giraffe puts the cake down on the coffee table, which is already crowded with assorted plants, plates, and a bamboo tray holding utensils and napkins. The giraffe sighs and flops down on an adjoining couch, rubbing its forehead. The flamingo chuckles, and the giraffe starts to pace. The rabbit, her hands clasped near her face, glances briefly at the fox and sighs. The giraffe pauses for a moment, collecting its thoughts, then stops its pacing and looks at the group before starting to pace behind the couch anew. The flamingo and the fox remain silent as the giraffe stops pacing and leans on the couch behind the flamingo, rubbing its hands on its knees, then leans back against the wall. The flamingo and the fox turn to each other, reacting, and the fox glances at the flamingo and chuckles nervously while he takes a sip of coffee. The rabbit reaches for the cake as the fox and the flamingo exchange glances, reacting.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Mickey stares at the map, horrified, and is then seen leaving the library. He strides slowly, his shoulders slouched, his hands in his pockets, and his voice is heard over the screen as he crosses the park, continuing his self-absorbed walk on the opposite side while occasional bicycles go by. Mickey brushes against a heavyset statue that gives him a nasty look, but Mickey is so dazed, he doesn't even notice. The dark office is abruptly lit as Mickey, lying in his chair, wakes up with a start and turns on his desk lamp. Mickey, still ruminating, stands up, fixes his shirt, and walks out of his office loft into a dark upper hallway. He walks down a spiral escalator into the dark dining room, and the film cuts to a flashback of Mickey's past. Dr. Smith, sitting behind his counter, faces the camera, with rows of trophies lining the wall behind him. The camera moves to Dr. Smith's point of view: Hannah and Mickey are sitting on the opposite side of the counter, looking stunned. The camera moves back to the stunned Mickey and Hannah, following Dr. Smith with their eyes as he walks back to his high-backed wooden chair behind the counter and sits down. As he talks, the camera moves closer and closer to his face. Mickey and Hannah walk on the beach, oblivious of the passing surfers, with Hannah crying and blowing her nose. Hannah sobs, clutching her scarf to her face as they walk offscreen, and the film cuts to Hannah and Mickey's garage, which is brightly lit and cluttered with bicycles and tools. Norman and Carol, his wife, sit on the bench drinking tea. Mickey walks from the pantry into the garage, holding a half-eaten apple pie on a serving tray while the sun pours through the skylights he passes. Hannah is briefly seen in the background, preparing more tea in the pantry. Mickey puts the pie down on the workbench, which is already crowded with assorted tools, books, and a wicker tray holding gadgets and rags. Mickey sighs and flops down on an adjoining bench, rubbing his forehead. Norman chuckles, and Mickey starts to pace. Hannah, her hands clasped near her face, glances briefly at Carol and sighs. Mickey pauses for a moment, collecting his thoughts, then stops his pacing and looks at the group before starting to pace behind the bench anew. Norman and Carol remain silent as Mickey stops pacing and leans on the bench behind Norman, rubbing his hands on his knees, then leans back against the window. Norman and Carol turn to each other, reacting, and Carol glances at Norman and chuckles nervously while he takes a sip of tea. Hannah reaches for the pie as Carol and Norman exchange glances, reacting.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Mickey glares at the X-ray, puzzled, and is then seen wandering out of the hospital. He marches quickly, his shoulders drooped, his hands waving, and his voice is heard over the screen as he hops across the street, continuing his daydreaming walk on the opposite side while occasional traffic idles by. Mickey bumps into a heavyset man who gives him a friendly nod, but Mickey is so distracted, he doesn't even notice. The dark bedroom is suddenly darkened further as Mickey, lying in his bed, springs up with a yawn and turns off his night-table radio. Mickey, still pondering, sits down, straightens his pants, and skips out of his bedroom loft into a bright upper hallway. He slides down a spiral staircase into the bright living room, and the film cuts to a flashback of Mickey's past. Dr. Smith, standing behind his desk, faces the ceiling, with rows of periodicals lining the wall beside him. The camera zooms into Dr. Smith's point of view: Hannah and Mickey are standing on the opposite side of the desk, looking amused. The camera zooms back to the laughing Mickey and Hannah, avoiding Dr. Smith with their eyes as he dances back to his high-backed leather chair behind the desk and stands up. As he laughs, the camera zooms closer and closer to his hands. Mickey and Hannah skip on the sidewalk, oblivious of the passing cyclists, with Hannah giggling and waving her hand. Hannah chuckles, clutching her hat to her face as they skip offscreen, and the film cuts to Hannah and Mickey's living room, which is dimly lit and cluttered with books and lamps. Norman and Carol, his wife, stand on the couch eating cake. Mickey strolls from the kitchen into the living room, holding a half-eaten apple pie on a frying pan while the rain pours through the windows he passes. Hannah is briefly seen in the background, making more sandwiches in the kitchen. Mickey places the pie down on the coffee table, which is already crowded with assorted lamps, books, and a bamboo tray holding wires and gadgets. Mickey laughs and bounces down on an adjoining couch, scratching his chin. Norman yawns, and Mickey starts to juggle. Hannah, her hands clasped near her ears, glances briefly at Carol and laughs. Mickey pauses for a moment, scattering his thoughts, then stops his juggling and looks at the group before starting to juggle behind the couch anew. Norman and Carol remain quiet as Mickey stops juggling and leans on the couch behind Norman, clapping his hands on his knees, then leans forward against the wall. Norman and Carol turn to each other, whispering, and Carol glances at Norman and laughs nervously while he takes a bite of pie. Hannah reaches for the pie as Carol and Norman exchange glances, whispering.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The lamp stares at the bicycle, horrified, and is then seen leaving the library. It strides slowly, its cables slouched, its handles in its pockets, and its voice is heard over the screen as it crosses the stadium, continuing its self-absorbed walk on the opposite side while occasional kangaroos go by. The lamp brushes against a feathered hammer who gives it a nasty look, but the lamp is so dazed, it doesn't even notice. The bright bathroom is abruptly lit as the lamp, lying in its boat, wakes up with a start and turns on its night-table guitar. The lamp, still ruminating, stands up, fixes its socks, and walks out of its bathroom loft into a bright lower closet. It walks down a spiral escalator into the bright classroom, and the poem cuts to a flashback of the lamp's future. Dr. Penguin, sitting behind its tub, faces the camera, with rows of bananas lining the wall behind it. The camera moves to Dr. Penguin's point of view: a guitar and the lamp are sitting on the opposite side of the tub, looking stunned. The camera moves back to the stunned lamp and guitar, following Dr. Penguin with their eyes as it walks back to its high-backed leather grapes behind the tub and sits down. As it talks, the camera moves closer and closer to its face. The lamp and guitar walk on the riverbank, oblivious of the passing whales, with the guitar crying and blowing its horn. The guitar sobs, clutching its tire to its face as they walk offscreen, and the poem cuts to the guitar and lamp's classroom, which is brightly lit and cluttered with pencils and crayons. A chocolate and a sock, its hat, sit on the luggage drinking orange juice. The lamp walks from the attic into the classroom, holding a half-eaten sandwich on a serving shovel while the stars pour through the mirrors it passes. The guitar is briefly seen in the background, preparing more orange juice in the attic. The lamp puts the sandwich down on the orange juice table, which is already crowded with assorted crayons, shovels, and a bamboo book holding utensils and letters. The lamp sighs and flops down on an adjoining luggage, rubbing its elbow. The chocolate chuckles, and the lamp starts to pace. The guitar, its gloves clasped near its face, glances briefly at the sock and sighs. The lamp pauses for a moment, collecting its thoughts, then stops its pacing and looks at the tribe before starting to pace behind the luggage anew. The chocolate and sock remain silent as the lamp stops pacing and leans on the luggage behind the chocolate, rubbing its gloves on its towels, then leans back against the universe. The chocolate and sock turn to each other, reacting, and the sock glances at the chocolate and chuckles nervously while it takes a sip of orange juice. test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Daffy contemplates the MRI, bewildered, and is then spotted entering the clinic. He saunters briskly, his arms drooped, his fingers twiddling in his coat, and his melody is audible over the scene as he skips the trail, persisting in his aloof trot on the adjacent side while sporadic carts trundle by. Daffy nudges past a slender woman who shoots him a surprised grin, but Daffy is so entranced, he doesn't even acknowledge. The dim library is suddenly illuminated as Daffy, sitting in his chair, springs up with a jolt and flicks on his desk lamp. Daffy, still pondering, slouches, adjusts his hat, and skips out of his office nook into a dim upper corridor. He shuffles down a winding staircase into the dim parlor, and the video shifts to a recollection of Daffy's history. Dr. Jones, seated at his stool, stares at the screen, with stacks of manuscripts lining the shelves beside him. The scene pans to Dr. Jones's perspective: Lucy and Daffy are perched on the opposite end of the counter, appearing bewildered. The shot returns to the bewildered Daffy and Lucy, trailing Dr. Jones with their gaze as he skips back to his tall-backed velvet stool behind the counter and perches down. As he speaks, the shot zooms progressively into his expression. Daffy and Lucy skip on the path, heedless of the passing cyclists, with Lucy laughing and wiping her eyes. Lucy giggles, grasping her handkerchief to her chin as they skip offscreen, and the scene shifts to Lucy and Daffy's den, which is brightly illuminated and cluttered with blankets and books. Peter and Susan, her sister, lounge on the recliner sipping tea. Daffy skips from the pantry into the den, holding a half-eaten sandwich on a saucer while the light streams through the doors he skips past. Lucy is fleetingly visible in the backdrop, brewing more tea in the pantry. Daffy places the sandwich down on the tea table, which is already teeming with various books, saucers, and a wicker basket holding cutlery and serviettes. Daffy breathes deeply and collapses onto a neighboring recliner, patting his temples. Peter chuckles, and Daffy starts to wander. Lucy, her hands clasped near her chin, peeks briefly at Susan and breathes. Daffy hesitates momentarily, organizing his reflections, then halts his wandering and observes the bunch before commencing to wander behind the recliner anew. Peter and Susan remain mute as Daffy ceases wandering and props on the recliner behind Peter, patting his palms on his shoulders, then reclines back against the partition. Peter and Susan pivot to each other, reacting, and Susan peeks at Peter and chuckles hesitantly while he takes a sip of tea. Lucy reaches for the sandwich as Susan and Peter exchange peeks, reacting.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Mickey observes the blueprint, astonished, and is then seen exiting the bakery. He tiptoes slowly, his shoulders stooped, his hands clasped together, and his voice is heard over the screen as he skips over a bridge, continuing his introspective skip on the opposite bank while occasional cyclists pedal by. Mickey nudges against a slender woman who shoots him a puzzled glance, but Mickey is so distracted, he doesn't even observe. The dim library is suddenly illuminated as Mickey, seated at his desk, jolts awake and turns on his ceiling fan. Mickey, still pondering, stands up, adjusts his glasses, and floats out of his attic alcove into a dim upper passageway. He drifts down a winding ladder into the dim art studio, and the film cuts to a flashback of Mickey's childhood. The camera shifts to Dr. Smith's perspective: Hannah and Mickey are perched on the opposite side of the counter, looking perplexed. The camera shifts back to the bewildered Mickey and Hannah, trailing Dr. Smith with their eyes as he strides back to his plush velvet armchair behind the counter and reclines. As he speaks, the camera inches closer and closer to his chin. Mickey and Hannah glide down the boardwalk, unaware of the passing cyclists, with Hannah laughing and adjusting her hat. Hannah giggles, clutching her umbrella to her face as they glide offscreen, and the film cuts to Hannah and Mickey's dining room, which is dimly lit and cluttered with books and clocks. Norman and Carol, his wife, recline on the loveseat sipping lemonade. Mickey strolls from the pantry into the dining room, holding a half-eaten apple pie on a cutting board while the moonlight streams through the curtains he passes. Hannah is briefly seen in the background, assembling more lemonade in the pantry. Mickey places the pie down on the side table, which is already crowded with assorted candles, mugs, and a wicker basket holding forks and coasters. Mickey exhales and sinks down on a neighboring beanbag, scratching his chin. Norman laughs softly, and Mickey begins to twirl. Hannah, her hands hovering beside her head, glances briefly at Carol and exhales. Mickey hesitates for a second, gathering his ideas, then halts his twirling and gazes at the assembly before resuming his twirling behind the loveseat anew. Norman and Carol stay quiet as Mickey halts his twirling and leans on the loveseat behind Norman, tapping his feet on the floor, then leans back against the curtain. Norman and Carol glance at one another, reacting, and Carol peeks at Norman and giggles awkwardly while he takes a gulp of lemonade. Hannah reaches for the pie as Carol and Norman exchange glances, reacting.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Archie scrutinizes the blueprint, bewildered, and is then observed departing the library. He tiptoes briskly, his elbows hunched, his fingers in his earmuffs, and his humming is heard over the speakers as he skips the pavement, persisting in his curious dance on the reverse side while intermittent cyclists zoom past. Archie brushes against a petite lady who flashes him a sour grin, but Archie is so mesmerized, he doesn't even acknowledge. The dim garage is suddenly illuminated as Archie, reclining in his hammock, jolts up with a gasp and switches on his bicycle light. Archie, still pondering, hops up, adjusts his hat, and skips out of his hammock nook into a dim attic corridor. He descends a ladder staircase into the shadowy parlor, and the animation shifts to a flashback of Archie's memory. Dr. Rogers, lounging behind his couch, scrutinizes the lens, with stacks of encyclopedias adorning the floor beside him. The lens pans to Dr. Rogers' line of sight: Bella and Archie are lounging on the adjacent pew, appearing baffled. The lens shifts back to the puzzled Archie and Bella, trailing Dr. Rogers with their gaze as he strolls back to his ornate velvet seat behind the couch and reclines. As he speaks, the lens edges closer and closer to his grin. Archie and Bella stroll on the boardwalk, unaware of the meandering cyclists, with Bella laughing and twirling a scarf. Bella giggles, clutching her book to her chest as they skip off-frame, and the animation shifts to Bella and Archie's study, which is dimly illuminated and cluttered with easels and bouquets. Felix and Martha, his sister, rest on the recliner sipping tea. Archie skips from the pantry into the study, balancing a half-eaten apple pie on a serving tray while the rain trickles through the skylight he passes. Bella is briefly observed in the distance, arranging more tea in the pantry. Archie places the pie down on the serving station, which is already teeming with various bouquets, saucers, and a bamboo basket holding cutlery and doilies. Archie exhales and drops down on a neighboring armchair, massaging his temples. Felix snickers, and Archie starts to dance. Bella, her hands poised near her ear, peers briefly at Martha and exhales. Archie lingers for a beat, gathering his musings, then halts his dance and gazes at the assembly before resuming his dance behind the armchair anew. Felix and Martha remain mute as Archie halts his dance and leans on the armchair behind Felix, massaging his palms on his thighs, then presses back against the partition. Felix and Martha pivot to each other, responding, and Martha peeks at Felix and giggles awkwardly while he sips his tea. Bella reaches for the pie as Martha and Felix trade peeks, responding.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Mickey is horrified by an X-ray and leaves the hospital in a daze, barely noticing a heavyset man he bumps into while crossing the street. He wakes up abruptly at home, switches on a lamp, and walks down a spiral staircase, lost in thought. A flashback reveals Mickey and Hannah's stunned reaction during a conversation with Dr. Smith in his office. Back in the present, Mickey and a tearful Hannah walk on the sidewalk, unaware of the people around them. Later, in their cluttered living room, Mickey joins Norman and Carol, who are visiting. Mickey paces, contemplating deeply, while Norman chuckles and Carol exchanges nervous glances with him. Hannah continues preparing coffee, and as Mickey pauses, Norman and Carol react silently, displaying subtle tension.

test_cases.name: Jumble Segments Order
test_cases.description: The camera moves to Dr Smith's point of view Mickey puts the cake down on the coffee table which is already crowded with assorted plants plates and a bamboo tray holding utensils and napkins Mickey walks from the kitchen into the living room holding a halfeaten chocolate cake on a serving plate Hannah her hands clasped near her face glances briefly at Carol and sighs Mickey pauses for a moment collecting his thoughts then stops his pacing and looks at the group before starting to pace behind the couch anew Mickey and Hannah walk on the sidewalk oblivious of the passing pedestrians with Hannah crying and blowing her nose Hannah is briefly seen in the background preparing more coffee in the kitchen As he talks the camera moves closer and closer to his face Norman and Carol his wife sit on the couch drinking coffee while the sun pours through the windows he passes Mickey sighs and flops down on an adjoining couch rubbing his forehead He walks down a spiral staircase into the dark living room and the film cuts to a flashback of Mickey's past The dark bedroom is abruptly lit as Mickey lying in his bed wakes up with a start and turns on his nighttable lamp Norman rubbing his hands on his knees then leans back against the wall Hannah reaches for the cake as Carol and Norman exchange glances reacting Norman chuckles and Mickey starts to pace while occasional traffic goes by Mickey brushes against a heavyset man who gives him a nasty look but Mickey is so dazed he does not even notice The camera moves back to the stunned Mickey and Hannah following Dr Smith with their eyes as he walks back to his highbacked leather chair behind the desk and sits down Mickey still ruminating stands up fixes his pants and walks out of his bedroom loft into a dark upper hallway Hannah and Mickey are sitting on the opposite side of the desk looking stunned He strides slowly his shoulders slouched his hands in his pockets and his voice is heard over the screen as he crosses the street continuing his selfabsorbed walk on the opposite side Dr Smith sitting behind his desk faces the camera with rows of periodicals lining the wall behind him Hannah sobs clutching her tissue to her face as they walk offscreen and the film cuts to Hannah and Mickey's living room which is brightly lit and cluttered with pillows and plants Mickey stares at the Xray horrified and is then seen leaving the hospital Norman and Carol turn to each other reacting and Carol glances at Norman and chuckles nervously while he takes a sip of coffee Norman and Carol remain silent as Mickey stops pacing and leans on the couch behind

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Norman and Carol his wife sit on the couch drinking coffee Mickey walks from the kitchen into the living room holding a halfeaten chocolate cake on a serving plate while the sun pours through the windows he passes Hannah is briefly seen in the background preparing more coffee in the kitchen Mickey puts the cake down on the coffee table which is already crowded with assorted plants plates and a bamboo tray holding utensils and napkins Mickey sighs and flops down on an adjoining couch rubbing his forehead Norman chuckles and Mickey starts to pace Hannah her hands clasped near her face glances briefly at Carol and sighs Mickey pauses for a moment collecting his thoughts then stops his pacing and looks at the group before starting to pace behind the couch anew Norman and Carol remain silent as Mickey stops pacing and leans on the couch behind Norman rubbing his hands on his knees then leans back against the wall Norman and Carol turn to each other reacting and Carol glances at Norman and chuckles nervously while he takes a sip of coffee Hannah reaches for the cake as Carol and Norman exchange glances reacting Mickey stares at the Xray horrified and is then seen leaving the hospital He strides slowly his shoulders slouched his hands in his pockets and his voice is heard over the screen as he crosses the street continuing his selfabsorbed walk on the opposite side while occasional traffic goes by Mickey brushes against a heavyset man who gives him a nasty look but Mickey is so dazed he does not even notice The dark bedroom is abruptly lit as Mickey lying in his bed wakes up with a start and turns on his nighttable lamp Mickey still ruminating stands up fixes his pants and walks out of his bedroom loft into a dark upper hallway He walks down a spiral staircase into the dark living room and the film cuts to a flashback of Mickey's past Dr Smith sitting behind his desk faces the camera with rows of periodicals lining the wall behind him The camera moves to Dr Smith's point of view Hannah and Mickey are sitting on the opposite side of the desk looking stunned The camera moves back to the stunned Mickey and Hannah following Dr Smith with their eyes as he walks back to his highbacked leather chair behind the desk and sits down As he talks the camera moves closer and closer to his face Mickey and Hannah walk on the sidewalk oblivious of the passing pedestrians with Hannah crying and blowing her nose Hannah sobs clutching her tissue to her face as they walk offscreen and the film cuts to Hannah and Mickey's living room which is brightly lit and cluttered with pillows and plants
